3.Title: Primo Geovishap
3.Desc: A Primo Geovishap awoken from a centuries-long slumber that can absorb different kinds of elemental power to unleash a Primordial Shower infused with Hydro, Pyro, Cryo, or Electro. If this attack hits a character protected by a <color=#f39001>shield</color>, the Primo Geovishap will take some DMG in return. If <color=#f39001>the shield's elemental type is Geo</color> or it <color=#f39001>matches that of the Primordial Shower</color>, the amount of reflected DMG will be increased...

6.Title: Electro Regisvine
6.Desc: A predatory plant in the same vein as the Cryo and Pyro Regisvines, this creature can create an organ that resembles <color=#f39001>Electro Cores</color> at its roots or corolla. When this type of organ starts to shift, its state will change, condensing into either a Waxing Stamen or a Waning Stamen. When the two types of stamens are present at the same time, they will <color=#f39001>attract one another and then unleash a powerful electrical explosion when they make contact</color>. Destroying these stamens quickly is key to an easier battle experience.

8.Title: Gluttonous Yumkasaur Mountain King
8.Desc: A Yumkasaurus that has experienced numerous impressive battles. It is not some abnormal mutant but has grown into its current shape due to its gluttony. It will collect Flamegranates during combat and spit them out as bombs. However, if you can use <color=#f39001>Pyro to ignite the Flamegranates</color> before the Gluttonous Yumkasaur Mountain King can swallow them, who knows what might happen...

8.Title: Solitary Suanni
8.Desc: An illuminated beast that dwells deep within the mountains that can use <color=#f39001>Hydro</color> and <color=#f39001>Anemo</color> simultaneously in battle. Render it Frozen while it is gathering <color=#f39001>Hydro</color>-aligned adeptal energy, before using <color=#f39001>Shatter, Melt, or other Elemental Reactions</color> to break the ice and cause it to enter an immobile state. When it is gathering <color=#f39001>Anemo</color>-aligned adeptal energy, use <color=#f39001>attacks from Elements that can react with Anemo</color> to destroy the Spiritwind Pearls summoned during the process to achieve the same advantage.
